newsitem.title: UK: Kazakh national grid tender result seen imminent.
newsitem.headline: Kazakh national grid tender result seen imminent.

text.p: Kazakhstan expects a final decision soon on a tender to operate its power transmission system and it is negotiating exclusively with Britain's National Grid Group, Economy Minister Umirzak Shukeyev said on Monday.
"We are now conducting exclusive talks with National Grid. We have some questions on various aspects, in particular on tariffs, on royalty payments and the investment programme," he told Reuters.
Shukeyev, speaking after a presentation at the annual meeting of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), said all outstanding issues could be settled soon.
"Our positions are rather close already and I think an agreement will be reached in the coming days," he said.
Other questions to be answered in the talks include the timing of National Grid's move to operate the network and technical questions, such as when to install meters on the lines, he added.

Last month, National Grid announced it had secured exclusive negotiating rights for a 25-year contract to manage the former Soviet republic's 16,000-km (10,000-mile) high voltage grid, putting Sweden's ABB out of the running.

Asked if ABB was still in the picture, Shukeyev said: "At the moment we are negotiating with National Grid. If for some reason it doesn't work out, we reserve the right (to approach another company)." The Kazakh electric power grid is regarded as a strategic asset and will not be privatised. Details of the operating contract are secret.
